Great Game so far

The short: Starts out kinda slow, but it's a great alternate world of the Guilded Age that's achingly beautiful to play in. The shooting mechanic is fun but generic, as is the spellcasting/Vigors powers which is a little dissappointing. This is all secondary towards the story telling which is excellently voiced and written, though pacing in the beginning needs work. There are plot holes (the ending, the mother story thread, etc) and jarring game mechanics (Elizabeth's powers) but nothing preventing you from wanting  to see how this all unveils. For all my quibbles, it's smoothed out with the charming characters and world that Infinite presents.

The Long:
After 2 hours in to Infinite, I stopped playing this game. 
I felt bored, and as pretty as the world was presented in this wonderous alternate steam-punk reality of a cotton candied 1910-esque US, it just wasn't enought to keep me interested because I've seen this theme many times in lower detail and quality, and after 10 minutes wondering around, it all felt familiar. The clever plot points were slipped in from early on, but a bit too obvious and/or heavy handedly but at least a good attempt was made.  The gun play is typical, movement was typical, vigors/spells were unique enough but nothing unheard of. And that's when I stopped. The story was being too subtle, especially for a player like me, who wants to see all places presented, thus making the story even slower. 
 
After some nudging from friends, I booted it back on and trudged forward. Once you meet Elizabeth, everything this world and story was building upon started to click. Factions, trials, wonders, backstory, expositories, trageties, horrors, betrayals and tender moments all come at you like a torrential storm surge, each trying to overwhelm the other in waves. Weirdly, through this maelstrom of motivations and hatched plots, the characters and why the world is the way it is, was and/or to be all make some semblance of sense, albeit broken sense if you're not caught up in the spectical/revelation and think about it a bit. The voice acting and dialog is wonderful and believable, there is chemistry between Booker and Elisabeth in their voicing and 3D depictions. You get the sense of balance between tragedy and resilience from Elisabeth, while Booker is definately a man with a past and skin he's not comfortable in anymore.

The ending... I'll let you be the judge due to the nature of it. It's definitely you take what you will with it since there really isn't a proper answer besides speculation to be honest. The one the game presents is possible but flawed in my mind, but given the game's title, who am I to really judge? Play it and see if you choose to believe it as it is one of the infinite possibilities.
if you have money buy this game
Cool game, great gameplay, and awesome story. Definitely recommend.

A Beautifully crafted game to perfect. Varieties of weapon and combat styles to manipulate your enemies with fun. An experience that will fascinate you along with its gorgeous graphics, audio, as well as its story. Fight in anyway you wany and maybe with a little special help.

В целом, разработчики хорошо постарались с этой игрой, мир Колумбии, летающий и ломающий все законы физики сделан красиво, креативно. Боевая система, возможности персонажей, делают эту игру непохожей на другие. Враги сделаны тоже очень интересно, особенности врагов, например Патриоту стрелять в спину, Механику в сердце. НО СЮЖЕТ, СЮЖЕТ МЕНЯ ПРОСТО УБИЛ. Все началось с того как Элизабет открыла разрыв в другой мир, все враги которых я убил, были живы, так продолжалось еще несколько раз, и еще, эти гоблины, которые бились головами о стены и их парни с дудками на головах. Я ПРОСТО ЛУТАЛ СТОЛ, КАК ОБЕРНУЛСЯ, А ОН СТОИТ У МЕНЯ ЗА СПИНОЙ, Я ПРОСТО НАПРОСТО НАВЕРНУЛСЯ СО СТУЛА, И ПОКА Я ВСТАВАЛ, ОН ПОЗВАЛ ЭТИХ ГОБЛИНОВ И МЕНЯ ЗАПИНАЛИ. НУ ЭТО ЕЩЕ ЧТО, В КОНЦЕ МОЙ МОЗГ ОКОНЧАТЕЛЬНО ОТКАЗАЛСЯ ПОНИМАТЬ ВСЕ ЭТИ ПАРАЛЛЕЛЬНЫЕ МИРЫ И ПРОЧИЙ БРЕД, ВСЕ ЭТИ ТЕРКИ МЕЖДУ ПЕРСОНАЖАМИ, КТО КЕМ КОМУ ПРИХОДИТСЯ, ЧТО ОН ДЛЯ КОГО ЗНАЧИТ, ПОЧЕМУ БУКЕР НАЧИНАЕТ МЕРЦАТЬ И У НЕГО ИДЕТ КРОВЬ ИЗ НОСА, ЧТО ОН НАЧИНАЕТ ВСПОМИНАТЬ.ПОКА Я НЕ МОГ ВСЕ ЭТО ПЕРЕВАРИТЬ МЕНЯ ДОБИЛА КОНЦОВКА (тут без спойлеров) Я ПРОСТО СИДЕЛ И ВТЫКАЛ В ТИТРЫ, ПЫТАЯСЬ ОСОЗНАТЬ ЧТО Я СЕЙЧАС ПРОШЕЛ, Я ПЕРЕПРОШЕЛ ЕЩЕ РАЗ, ОБЛАЗИЛ КУЧУ ФОРУМОВ И САЙТОВ, РАЗГОВАРИВАЛ С ДРУЗЬЯМИ, ПОКА Я НАКОНЕЦ НЕ ПОНЯЛ ЧТО ЗА БРЕД ТАМ ПРОИСХОДИЛ.

Playing this game is like a blast to the past with their current era style. It's really fun. I like how you can make decisions in this game.

I really like the music in this game. It reminds me of the Oldies (40's-70's) music. The big band music is always so much fun to listen to!

My personal favorite vigor to use is "murdering crow". For my second vigor I switch off between "shock jockey" and "devil's kiss". There's just something about watching my enemies get ripped apart by crows that just makes me laugh and say "You fools should not have challenged me." It makes me think of the infected crows in Resident Evil, except they are attacking your enemies and not you.

I highly reccomend using an compatible controller to play this game. (I use the Xbox 360 controller)

***EDIT August 6, 2014***

So I just finished the game and I enjoyed this game immensly. I will say that you will get the biggest mind fuck at the end of the game. DO NOT look at the wiki or go onto youtube to find out the ending. If you do and have not finished the game it WILL ruin the entire game for you.
Do yourself a favor and buy this game. Amazing story, and insane ending. Haven't been sucked into a game for a while, and this one had my full attention for a couple of days until I beat it.
Everything about this game is FANTASTIC! I dont know what more I can say.

Absolutely an amazing game. The gameplay and mechanics are fun. The world is stunning and extremely appealing. The action is fast. There are hours upon hours of play in the downloadable content. Yes, it is related to and is linked to the previous Bioshock games. Approximately a 12-15 hour game on normal which is also a plus.
Though nothing like the other Bioshocks in atmosphere, this game did not disapoint. Fun gameplay, smooth, and story was excellent. A great game that has to be experienced if one enjoys Bioshock.

Jeu spectaculaire sans équivoque, les développeurs ont réussi un jeu unique ! L'introduction est bluffante : on ne sait vers quelle direction l'histoire va se diriger. Mais c'est surtout l'ambiguité qui règne dans le synopsis, elle porte à confusion, tout en intriguant et en faisant réfléchir. Après tout, le cinéma d'aujourd'hui comme d'hier (Matrix..) nous rempli de fascination pour des mondes parallèles et infinis, avons-nous des alter-égo vivant un destin différent du nôtre? Ce jeu y apporte une réponse tout en beauté !
The ending will cause liquids to ooze out of every orifice you have. In a good way.

The first in the series of Bioshock I have played. I now wonder what I have missed with the other 2. An immersive story, one with an ending that actually gave me a surprise. (no spoilers). Easy on medium, but if you enjoy a challenge then hard or 1999 mode will meet your needs. The season pass content I am working through. Although enjoyable, are very short in length, but create depth to the story.

Yaklaşık 10 saatlik bir oynayışın ardından oyunu bitirdim. Aslında oynayışla alakalı zorlayıcı ya da çok zaman alan bir etken yok ancak sağda solda bulabileceğiniz takviyeler için vakit harcarsanız iyi olur. Oyun adeta bir macera/gizem türünde film edasıyla çekiyor bizi içine. Aynı sebeple olacak ki oyun bittikten sonra jenerik akmaya başladığında ben hala donuk gözlerle ekrana bakıyordum. Oyunu bir filme benzetme sebeplerimden biri de bir bilim-kurgu filminde rastlayabileceğiniz harika görsellere yer verilmiş olması. 

Ayrıntılar konusunda dikkatliyseniz ve oyun içerisinde direkt ana görevi yapmak yerine çevrede zaman geçirmeyi seviyorsanız fazlasıyla eğlenebileceğiniz bir oyundur.

Bioshock Infinite is simply brilliant. The storyline, while seeming chaotic as you go along gets explained completely and clearly as you near the end. It's a rollercoaster of both action and adventure. 

And that's not even including the Burial At Sea DLC's. To return to Rapture AND see the story evolve, it's simply nostalgic on top of constantly keeping you on your toes. Well done Irrational and 2K, you guys know how to put together a fantastic game.

Review:
Bioshock Infinite ist eins der Spiele mit dem größten Hype 2013. 

Ich habe mir das Spiel gekauft, ohne große Vorurteile. 
Am Anfang hat das Spiel auch Spaß gemacht. Sah nach ner lustigen Spielwelt aus und einer Story die spannend werden könnte. Könnte ist hierbei der absolut richtige Ausdruck, denn es war eins der langweiligsten Spiele die ich gespielt habe. 

Die Grafik ist gut, das ist aber auch das einzig gute. Die Story war total schlecht und langweilig, so dass ich mich öfter aufmuntern musste das Spiel weiter zuspielen. Das Gameplay ist zudem auch nicht das gelbe vom Ei. Im großen gibt es 4-5 Gegnertypen die man aber nach und nach auswendig kennt. Dazu kommt dann noch, das es wirklich sehr sehr einfach war auf mittlerer Schwierigkeit. Einzig an einer Stelle musste ich öfter mich versuchen. 

Im Gesamten bleibt jedoch, dass ich dieses Spiel nicht hätte kaufen sollen. Ich bin jedoch froh, dass ich das Spiel durchgespielt habe und es dann endlich von der Festplatte löschen konnte.

If any of you gamers played Bioshock and/or Bioshock 2, then you might want to play this one.  The graphics are probably a step higher then the predecessors.

comparisons to the original aside, bioshock infinite is a very memorable game.

the gameplay is engaging, fluid, and above all just fun. the story has some awkward dialogue and at some points a schizophrenic idea of what its actually trying to say, but it still provides an engaging and interesting narrative about exploitation in society as well as cosmic horror, which it blends together surprisingly well, although not without some hitches.

its got plenty of minor problems, ill admit, but at the end of the day, i had a lot of fun with it, and i think about it to this day, 5 years afterwards.
